unnormalised: **Builder Reviews: Are You Getting the "Three Idiots" Treatment?**
normalised: builder reviews: are you getting the "three idiots" treatment?

unnormalised: Buying property? Hold up, folks! Before you sign on the dotted line for that dream flat in Gurgaon, check out those builder reviews! Turns out, navigating the real estate market can be trickier than cracking the IIT-JEE.
normalised: buying property? hold up, folks! before you sign on the dotted line for that dream flat in gurgaon, check out those builder reviews! turns out, navigating the real estate market can be trickier than cracking the I I T slash J E E.

unnormalised: Homebuyers are increasingly relying on online platforms to share their experiences - the good, the bad, and the downright ugly. We're talking everything from delayed possession (like, seriously, 2 years and counting!), shoddy construction, and hidden charges that would make even a CA sweat.
normalised: homebuyers are increasingly relying on online platforms to share their experiences - the good, the bad, and the downright ugly. we're talking everything from delayed possession (like, seriously, two years and counting!), shoddy construction, and hidden charges that would make even a C A sweat.

unnormalised: One user, Priya Sharma from Bangalore, shared her ordeal with ‘Paradise Developers,’ claiming promises of "world-class amenities" turned out to be a glorified playground. Ouch! Another, Mr. Gupta from Delhi, warned against a particular builder for raising prices Rs. 5 Lakh after booking!
normalised: one user, priya sharma from bangalore, shared her ordeal with ‘paradise developers,’ claiming promises of "world-class amenities" turned out to be a glorified playground. ouch! another, mister gupta from delhi, warned against a particular builder for raising prices rupee five lakh after booking!

unnormalised: These reviews are gold dust, especially for first-time buyers. Think of it as your pre-emptive strike against getting a raw deal. So, do your homework, read those reviews, and remember - “All is NOT well” until you've done your research! Avoid being a Munnabhai chasing after a non-existent building. Good luck!
